title: Welcome Dinner
description:
UC Davis is pleased to host the UCCSC Monday night reception on the grounds of the [Robert Mondavi Institute](http://robertmondaviinstitute.ucdavis.edu/) Good Life Garden. The [Good Life Garden](http://www.goodlifegarden.ucdavis.edu/location) contains an ever-changing edible landscape, which features organic and sustainably grown vegetables, herbs and flowers.

On Monday, August 13, enjoy food and wine in a beautiful setting and mingle with your colleagues with a view to a vineyard.
rsvp: [UCCSC registration](/schedule/2018-08-13/registration) will be available at the Monday night reception.

address.street: Old Davis Road Old Davis Road

title: Morning Yoga
description: A certified personal trainer will lead an outdoor morning yoga session. Participants will require a longer warm-up but will experience yoga the traditional way! Power Vinyasa Yoga is a combination of deep breathing and specifically sequenced set of flowing yoga poses. It has the ability not only to build strength, increase endurance, but also release tension, and create more flexibility in the entire body.

title: UC Drupal Community of Practice
description:
The UC Drupal Collaboration continues to gain momentum across the UC System. Drupal is the primary web publishing platform for the vast majority of UC campuses. In this meeting, we will come together to discuss the [UC-Wide SiteFarm platform](/sessions/meet-sitefarm-university-californias-drupal-8-collaboration) and best practices for development, service delivery, documentation and training, and more.

If you use Drupal in the UC System, you're not gonna want to miss this!

organizer.name: Shawn DeArmond
organizer.bio:
Shawn is the Web Architect for Information and Educational Technology at UC Davis. He supervises the Web Development team, which offers custom web development services to campus units, as well as builds and maintains the SiteFarm web platform service.

Shawn has been a UC Davis employee since 1997 and cut his teeth at the School of Education. Now in IET, he drives a high-performing team implementing state-of-the-art web technology. They use highly evolved development methodologies and workflows including established version control strategies, code-review practices, and automated testing, builds, and deployment.

In addition his work at UC Davis, Shawn is a founding member of the UC Drupal Collaboration, along with UCLA and UC San Francisco, in an effort to save costs and create a community of practice of web development across the UC System. He has also organized the Higher Education Drupal Summit at the Bay Area Drupal Camp and DrupalCon since 2010.

description: Take a break and take a ride through the UC Davis campus on a double-decker bus. Unitrans is well-known for our fleet of historic London double-decker buses, which in 2010 were joined by two [modern double-decker buses](https://unitrans.ucdavis.edu/media/uploads/2017/10/18/new-dd-bus-with-bikes.jpg).

title: Bowling at the Memorial Union
description:
Have some spare time? Check out the bowling alley at the Memorial Union on campus.

The Games Area has 12 bowling lanes. Bring your friends to play a quick game or rent out a lane by the hour! Bowling shoes are required. Bring your own socks please.

title: Morning Walk through the Arboretum
description: Walk up with a refreshing walk through the UC Davis Arboretum with a tour through California's living garden. This tour will be led by [Warren Roberts](http://publicgarden.ucdavis.edu/in-the-news/uc-davis-arboretum-superintendent-emeritus-warren-roberts-featured-in-davis-enterprise), the Superintendent Emeritus of the Arboretum.

description: Fortify yourself for an afternoon of conference sessions and networking with your colleagues.
rsvp: Lunch sponsored by [Microsoft](/sponsor/microsoft). Desserts sponsored by [Intervision Systems](/sponsor/intervision-systems)

address.street: 540 Alumni Lane 540 Alumni Lane

title: Happy Hour Social Mixer
description: Get to know your community during the social mixer. This networking event is reserved for just that. All of us are here because we share things in common; take this opportunity to connect with others that share your interests. Mix and mingle, find your counterparts across the UC system, and enjoy!

address.street: 550 Alumni Lane 550 Alumni Lane

title: Keynote Speaker: Andrew Isaacs
description:
Keynote speak Andrew Mansfield Isaacs will open Wednesday's schedule of events.

##### Andrew Mansfield Isaacs

University of California, Berkeley, Adjunct Professor, Haas School of Business

Faculty Director, Center for Executive Education

Andrew Isaacs is a successful scientist, business executive, entrepreneur, and educator. He is passionate about mentoring the next generation of business leaders and has a strong track record of helping entrepreneurs launch their careers. Isaacs has worked at the crossroads of Silicon Valley technology and business innovation for 35 years, 20 of those years at UC Berkeley, helping start-ups and established companies create and execute successful innovation strategies.

Isaacs joined the UC Berkeley faculty in 1999. In 2000 he was appointed Executive Director of UC Berkeley’s Management of Technology Program, the joint program of the Haas School of Business and College of Engineering. He co-founded UC Berkeley’s Center for Energy and Environmental Innovation in 2005, and since 2006 has served as Faculty Director of UC Berkeley’s Center for Executive Education. Isaacs is ranked one of the Top 15 professors in the US by 360Career.

##### Graduate Instruction

Isaacs teaches five MBA and Executive-level courses at UC Berkeley, and has instructed over 2,000 students in his courses:

*   Opportunity Recognition
*   High-tech Marketing
*   Innovation Strategies for Emerging Technologies
*   Technology Innovation
*   Technology and Entrepreneurship in Silicon Valley

##### Executive Education and Consulting

In addition to his work at UC Berkeley, Isaacs has taught Executive-level courses for more than 90 corporations, government agencies and other groups in the US, Europe and Asia. His courses focus on leadership, marketing, and innovation strategy. A list of current and prior engagements follows.

##### Before Berkeley

Prior to joining UC Berkeley, Isaacs held positions as a marketing and technology executive at public and private companies in Silicon Valley. Before coming to Silicon Valley, Isaacs was Senior Scientist at the NASA Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas. He holds BS and MS degrees in Geochemistry from the University of Michigan.

address.street: Mrak Hall Drive Mrak Hall Drive

title: Keynote Speaker: Diane Bryant
description:
Keynote speaker, Diane Bryant, will open Wednesday's schedule of events.

**Diane Bryant, COO Google Cloud**

Diane M. Bryant is focused on accelerating the scale and reach of Google Cloud. Most recently, Bryant was Group President of Intel’s Data Center Group, the worldwide organization that develops server, storage and network platforms for the digital services economy, growing it to $17 billion in revenue in 2016. Prior to that, Bryant was Intel’s Corporate Vice President and Chief Information Officer, responsible for the corporate-wide information technology solutions and services that enable Intel’s business.

Bryant sits on the board of directors for United Technologies Corporation, was named among Fortune’s 50 Most Powerful Women in Business in 2015 and 2016, and is a tireless advocate for women and underrepresented minorities in the fields of engineering and technology. She created the UC Davis Diane Bryant Endowed Scholarship for Women in Engineering and has also served on the technical board of the Anita Borg Institute, a non-profit organization focused on the advancement of women in computing.

Bryant received her bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering from U.C. Davis in 1985. She attended the Stanford Executive Program in 2011 and holds four U.S. patents.

title: Lunch
description: Fortify yourself for an afternoon of conference sessions and networking with your colleagues.
rsvp: Lunch sponsored by [Dasher Technologies](/sponsor/dasher-technologies). Desserts sponsored by [ePlus](/sponsor/eplus).

address.street: 540 Alumni Lane 540 Alumni Lane

title: All UC DocuSign Meet Up
description: DocuSign is being used in one way or another at all UC locations for electronic signature processes and forms automation. The UC-wide DocuSign special-interest-group continues to meet on monthly conference calls and via Slack. This forum will provide a face-to-face meet-up similar to the one held last year at UCCSC in San Diego. This forum will be open to any interested UCCSC attendees and will focus on sharing recent DocuSign activities, issues and directions from the reps each location. Please note there is a separate introductory session for DocuSign on the program where people who are not already active in the DocuSign SIG can learn more about the product and uses across UC.
rsvp: Contact Eric Taggart for more information: [etaggart@uci.edu](mailto:etaggart@uci.edu)

organizer.name: Eric Taggart
organizer.bio:
Associate Director, Enterprise Applications - UCI Office of Information Technology

I've been with UC since 1981 (UC Irvine Registrar's Office student programmer).  Co-created ASSIST (Articulation System Stimulating Interinstitutional Student Transfer) in 1984 as the lead developer, went on to serve as the Statewide Director for ASSIST from 1989 thru 2008 (under UCOP but located in Irvine).  UC Irvine Graduate Division IT Director in 2008, added Office of Research IT and other groups in subsequent years.  Now Associate Director, Enterprise Applications and overseeing Office of Research IT, HR IT, UCPath IT, Transportation & Distribution Services IT, Facilities Management IT, and Accounting/Financials/KFS IT (and some other miscellaneous).

title: Documentation for a Product or Service
description: For departments/teams who provide a technical product or service for the campus (for example, a website platform or hosting service, a learning management system, document management, etc.), and who also provide documentation on how to use that product or service. Discussion could include what platforms are used for documentation, how often documentation is updated, how it's organized, and more. The goal of this discussion would be to share tips and ideas so that we can better serve our customers with our documentation.

organizer.name: Anna Gazdowicz
organizer.bio: Anna is a Web and Accessibility Specialist at UC Berkeley, in central IT, for the Web Platform Services team. Web Platform Services manages the Open Berkeley website platform (turnkey web platform solution for campus websites), helps campus departments adhere to the UC web accessibility policy (clinics, consultation, resources), and facilitates the campus relationship with Pantheon (external website hosting provider). She lives in Berkeley with her husband, son, and cat, and enjoys music, podcasts, running, riding her bike, cooking, and eating.

title: Business Continuity Planners (BCP) and IT Disaster Recovery (ITDR) Planners at UC
description: Meet with other Business Continuity Planners and IT Disaster Recovery Planners from UC campuses and Medical Centers to discuss trends, experiences, tools and more.
rsvp: Contact Louis Zeoli for more information or to suggest additional discussion topics: [louis.zeoli@ucop.edu](mailto:louis.zeoli@ucop.edu)
